body_html:
Hi @the-dagger, thanks for the report. At the moment, the Java API does not support string inputs/outputs. This limitation is definitely on our radar, and something we plan to address in the near future.

Note that properly supporting strings will require some reworking of the current API. In particular, to support dynamically sized outputs, we'll need to decouple extracting output data from interpreter invocation. At the moment, the client needs to know the size of the output before invoking the interpreter, but this doesn't map well for dynamic outputs.

Note that properly supporting strings will require some reworking of the current API. In particular, to support dynamically sized outputs, we'll need to decouple extracting output data from interpreter invocation. At the moment, the client needs to know the size of the output before invoking the interpreter, but this doesn't map well for dynamic outputs.
body:
Hi @the-dagger, thanks for the report. At the moment, the Java API does not support string inputs/outputs. This limitation is definitely on our radar, and something we plan to address in the near future.

Note that properly supporting strings will require some reworking of the current API. In particular, to support dynamically sized outputs, we'll need to decouple extracting output data from interpreter invocation. At the moment, the client needs to know the size of the output *before* invoking the interpreter, but this doesn't map well for dynamic outputs.
